docs.snippet: An appeals court is deciding whether deputy U.S. marshals who shot and wounded a teenage driver eight years ago may be sued in federal court, a case that's unfolding amid a national debate about police use of force and the legal protections afford...
docs.lead_paragraph: An appeals court is deciding whether deputy U.S. marshals who shot and wounded a teenage driver eight years ago may be sued in federal court, a case that's unfolding amid a national debate about police use of force and the legal protections afforded to law enforcement.

headline.main: Appeals Court Weighs Suit in US Marshals Shooting
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Weighs Suit in US Marshals Shooting

docs.snippet: Investigators are now certain that 43 college students missing since September were killed and incinerated after they were seized by police in southern Guerrero state, the Mexican attorney general said Tuesday....

docs.snippet: The area’s turnaround from crime-ridden to family-friendly has brought in a sea of tourists, who are threatening to push out frustrated office tenants and theatergoers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The area’s turnaround from crime-ridden to family-friendly has brought in a sea of tourists, who are threatening to push out frustrated office tenants and theatergoers.
docs.abstract: Companies in Times Square say area is becoming too congested to conduct business; theater owners are enjoying record attendance, but some worry that tourists are pushing out New Yorkers, potential major problem when tourism inevitably begins to drop off.

headline.main: Times Square’s Crushing Success Raises Questions About Its Future
headline.print_headline: Times Square’s Crushing Success Raises Questions About Its Future
